BR_text.BRsummary: [releaser] Release test dependencies not being properly installed.
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS):
 When running the releaser , the rllib/tune related tests seem to fail due to dependency issues. Attached is the output of the impala test.
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/files/5778898/ray_command_output_scd_2vJnlEdLvBs7qUzYy3Y1vt.txt>ray_command_output_scd_2vJnlEdLvBs7qUzYy3Y1vt.txt</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 Please provide a short code snippet (less than 50 lines if possible) that can be copy-pasted to reproduce the issue. The snippet should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments):
 If the code snippet cannot be run by itself, the issue will be closed with "needs-repro-script".
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-code>  File "/root/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cv2/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
     from .cv2 import *
 ImportError: libGL.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
 </denchmark-code>

comments_1.comment_text: Are these running on ray or ray-ml docker images?

comments_2.comment_text:
ok i think the error was that we because we were using ray instead of ray-ml
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/blob/master/release/long_running_tests/cluster.yaml#L4>https://github.com/ray-project/ray/blob/master/release/long_running_tests/cluster.yaml#L4</denchmark-link>
